page.title: 20BROWN'S GARAGE_GREAT EASTON
page.content: Graham Brown lived at The Swan in Great Easton.In his garden he used to mend bicycles.He started a garage in Great Easton in 1947 and when he died in 1983 his son James took over.There are four people working in the garage at the moment,including James.One of the workers is a mechanic.In the garage they do car repairs and they tow in about 50 cars a year.The garage has 2 petrol pumps and 1 diesel pump. In a week they sell 3,000 gallons of petrol and 300 gallons of diesel. Brown's Garage is open between 8:00am and 8:00pm.They have an hour or just ten minutes for lunch depending on how busy they are.In Brown's Garage they have a shop where they sell sweets, ice-creams,postcards and spare-parts for cars.
